stu_tags: LECTURE HEAVY  GET READY TO READ  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Hes a nice guy but he gives a lot of work and sometimes not too clear about what he wants. You have to complete two concert reports , weekly chapter summaries , a term paper , listening quizzes and midterm and final exams . I was also annoyed that I had to purchase the text book just to write the chapter summaries , we never used it in class.

comments: Professor Diponio makes this boring course fun and understandable. the listening quizzes are easy, as well as the midterm. there is a lot of writing since is a writing intensive course such as 2 concert reports, chapter summaries and a term paper. I didn\'t mind tho I knew what I singed up for. the lecture are fun and he is a easy greater. The best!

comments: I wouldn\'t consider him a bad teacher, but he definitely needs improvement. the syllabus wasn\'t clear so you didn\'t have a clue when items were due. A lot of work you must stay on top of. Weekly Chapter summaries ( the only reason for the book), 2 Concert reports, 3 Music listening quizzes, 1 huge test and 1 Final. Test arent so bad. STUDY!!

He showed me that there is a lot of great music out there. if your one of the people who skips class all the time then you won\'t do well.

comments: The professor is a hard grader so watch out. The lectures were boring, it was hard for me to stay up. Too many assignments. This is a music history class so be aware. I didn\'t know that, I though it was class were I would learn to play some instruments but not. I regret taking this class, I did it for my advisor. The decision is yours.

comments: He is veerry boring but if you show up, do the readings, the papers, prep for the listening quizzes and exams(2) u`ll pass the class. Just pretend to be interested in the class even if you`re not. Its a music history class for those who aren`t aware, I didnt know when I enrolled. But I got an A!

He\'s horrible. And this is from a 4.0 student & my entire class agrees.
